New Records: Haris Rauf claimed his 100th T20I wicket.
Aaron Johnson hit boundaries off the first two balls in a men's T20 World Cup match for the first time.
Key Match Events: Aaron Johnson scored 52 off 44 balls for Canada.
Dilon Heyliger took 2 wickets for 18 runs for Canada.
Mohammad Amir took 2 wickets for 13 runs for Pakistan.
Haris Rauf took 2 wickets for 26 runs for Pakistan.
Mohammad Rizwan scored an unbeaten 53 off 52 balls for Pakistan.
Babar Azam scored 33 runs for Pakistan.
Pakistan won by 7 wickets with 15 balls remaining.
Pre-Game Insights: Babar Azam won the toss and chose to field first.
Saim Ayub was brought in place of Iftikhar Ahmed for Pakistan.
Post-Match Reflections: Mumtaz praised Mohammad Amir's brilliant and relentless bowling.
Babar Azam expressed disappointment at his dismissal but was pleased with the team's performance.
Rizwan emphasized the importance of the win despite the slow pitch conditions.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Canada faced 76 dot balls, the most in an innings at the men's T20 World Cup.
The sluggish outfield at the New York venue affected the scoring.
